Posts.Content: Dec 24, 2009 03:08PM - edited Dec 24, 2009 03:14PM by wildgardener Interesting!  I am on Femara, too.  In mid-September had an illness with very similar symptoms - high fever, headache, complete loss of appetite, skin sensitivity.  After the first week with severe symptoms, I had another two weeks before I was myself again.  My good husband kept me alive during the delirium period.  My dr. said it was a virus, but since I didn't go soon enough they didn't test to ID.  When H1N1 vaccine became available, I did take the shot.  The clinic recommended that I have it since my symptoms were rather unusual. My oncologist says that Femara doesn't depress the immune system, but it sure seems that I am healing more slowly and catch everything that comes around...  BTW, to answer your question, if taking the shot could prevent that illness, I'd take it in a heartbeat - that was the worst sickness I've ever had (and I'm 61 years old). I had both regular and H1N1 vaccines with no problem.
Posts.Title: H1N1 Poll--ALL STAGES WELCOME! badboob67 wildgardener
